intro: Corispermum villosum, commonly known as the hairy corisperm, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Corispermum villosum is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
